#Text=Make Kefta and Batata ( Meat and Potatoes Lebanese Style )
#Text=Kefta and batata , also known as “ kefta bi seniyah , ” which means in English kefta in a pan .
#Text=Kefta is a traditional Lebanese casserole that many grandmothers have been making for centuries .
#Text=Kefta is ground meat mixed in with chopped onions and parsley .
#Text=It 's super fast and easy to make , kefta is shaped into patties topped with potatoes and onions simmered with seasoned tomato paste .
#Text=This traditional Lebanese casserole is served with white vermicelli rice , and/or baked Lebanese bread .
#Text=This wikiHow will teach you how to make kefta and batata .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=¾ lb .
#Text=Kefta
#Text=3 Potatoes
#Text=2 Onions(optional )
#Text=2 Tomatoes(optional )
#Text=4 tsp .
#Text=Tomato Paste
#Text=2 ½ cups water
#Text=1 cube chicken bouillon/ or chicken broth
#Text=2 tsp .
#Text=Salt
#Text=1 tsp .
#Text=Black Pepper
#Text=1 T. Vegetable oils or coconut oil
#Text=Onion powder(optional )
#Text=Dill(optional )
#Text=.5 tsp . Thyme(optional )
#Text=.5 tsp .
#Text=Basil(optional )
#Text=2 cups medium grain rice
#Text=1 cup broken vermicelli pasta
#Text=2 ½ T. olive oil
#Text=1 tsp . salt
#Text=Steps
#Text=Wash your hands before touching the kefta .
#Text=You do not want to touch kefta and then touch the rest of the ingredients .
#Text=This will avoid any food-borne illness .
#Text=Form the kefta into circular patties with your hands .
#Text=You can make them as small or large as you want just depending on how large your casserole dish is .
#Text=Then place your kefta on the side on a separate plate .
#Text=Preheat your oven to 375F .
#Text=Spray your casserole dish with PAM or use coconut/vegetable oil .
#Text=Grab a separate casserole dish .
#Text=Then wash your potatoes and either peel or leave the skin depending on your preference .
#Text=Some people like to soak the potatoes for at least 15 mins before laying them on top of the kefta .
#Text=Let the potatoes soak for 15 minutes .
#Text=Then peel and slice them into ¼ inch thickness .
#Text=You want them to look like flying saucers .
#Text=Sprinkle the potatoes with salt and drizzle vegetable oil .
#Text=Lay on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or even just aluminium foil .
#Text=You can also add onion powder and dill for extra flavor ( optional ) .
#Text=Start baking the potatoes before the kefta .
#Text=It does take the potatoes a little longer to cook than the meat , you want everything to be cooked evenly .
#Text=Bake the potatoes in the oven for 25/30 minutes on 375F .
#Text=Flip the potatoes over halfway through baking .
#Text=If you soaked your potatoes before it might take less then 30 mins for them to turn a little brown .
#Text=Place the potatoes in too of the kefta patties .
#Text=You can do this once the potatoes have been in the oven for about 25/30 mins and are brown .
#Text=Add sliced ¼ thick onions and tomatoes on top if you desire .
#Text=Grab a separate bowl .
#Text=Add the tomato paste and dissolve it with water .
#Text=Stir the two ingredients for about 3 minutes then add in the chicken bouillon and stir for another 3 minutes .
#Text=You might want to add some extra seasoning .
#Text=Pour the mixture on top of the casserole .
#Text=Do not get worried that there is a lot of liquid it will dissolve .
#Text=Season with salt and pepper and then cover with aluminium foil and bake for 45 minutes on 375F .
#Text=Continue to check on the casserole halfway .
#Text=Make the rice and baked bread .
#Text=Rinse the rice , and let it soak in water for about 15-20 minutes .
#Text=Then grab a medium non-stick cooking pot , heat the olive oil and low/medium and add the vermicelli and stir continuously .
#Text=Add in the rice and continue to stir .
#Text=Add in 3 ½ cups of water and bring to a boil until the water is reduced , then turn heat to low .
#Text=Cook for 15-20 minutes while the kefta is still in the oven .
#Text=Remove the kefta from the oven after 45-50 minutes .
#Text=You may then add a piece of Lebanese bread on the plate along with the rice and top the kefta for a fine garnish .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you do not have chicken bouillon you can use chicken broth .
#Text=Again , that is totally optional for you .
#Text=You can also add extra vegetables on top for extra flavor .
#Text=If you would like to add a different vegetable depending on the preference you may ( ex . zucchini , eggplant ) .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=When adding the vermicelli , you have to make sure you keep an eye on it and stir continuously or it will burn and you will have to throw away and start all over .
#Text=Let the Kefta sit for about 10 minutes before eating because it will be extremely hot .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Casserole Dish
#Text=Cooking Pot
#Text=Measuring Cups ( ½ and 1 cup )
#Text=Aluminum Foil
